BodyTree#

This class represents a mechanical system consisting of bodies and joints serially interconneted.

class BodyTree#

Bases: handle

Class representing an open tree of joints and bodies serially connected.

Constructor Summary
BodyTree(Joints, Bodies)#

Construct a BodyTree consisting of joints and bodies.

Parameters:

  • Joints (Joint) – Cell array of joints

  • Bodies (Body) – Cell array of bodies

Property Summary
Bodies#

Bodies of the tree

Joints#

Joints of the tree

MassConditionNumber#

Mass condition numer

MaxBodiesNumber#

Define the maximum number of bodies and joints (required for code generation)

N_B#

Total number of bodies in the tree

T0#

Orientation of the base with respect to the world frame

g#

Gravity field in the base frame

n#

Total number of DoFs

Method Summary
ApparentForce(q, dq)#

Set gravity force to zero

ApparentMatrix(q, dq)#

Set gravity force to zero

D(q, dq)#

Update the tree only if q and dq are passed as arguments

EquilibriumConfiguration(q0, tau)#

options = optimoptions(‘fmincon’, ‘FunctionTolerance’, 1e-4); q_eq = fsolve(@(q) obj.EquilibriumEquation(q, tau), q0, options);

ForwardDynamics(q, dq, u)#

Compute the mass matrix

InverseDynamics(q, dq, ddq)#

Update the BodyTree

K(q)#

Update the tree only if q is passed as argument

Kane_aux(g, q_type)#

KANE_AUX Given a obj model compute the generalized force that realizes ddq in the state (q,dq)

MassMatrix(q)#

Store value of gravity and set gravity to zero to compute the mass matrix

TreeUpdate(q, dq, ddq)#

Update the state of the tree.
